column4: Can someone tell me how to mount a USB drive through terminal and copy files to it?
can you tell me pore specific commands
I didn't know what to write after "mount"
also what does a directory outside the filesystem look like?
sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /path/to/mount/point if it's FAT you need -o uid=username,gid=username,
sdb1 is just as an example,  tail|dmesg will tell you what device you just connected
it can be anything you want like /mnt or /home/lordjj/myusbstick
there is no such thing as "outside the filesystem" in Linux everthing is mounted within the "/" root filesystem
so after mounting, what will the directory to the USB drive look like?
same as E:\ in windows but at /mnt/Lazy/
can u write an example where you mount a USB drive and copy a folder from home to it?
OK so add a "-v" to the cp command and if you have special characters you might tell the mount command to use utf8, ask if you need details
if there are spaces in the folder names, I can use "" right?
correct, or single quotes or you escape with "\"
